Class Hangman

java.lang.Object
Hangman
public class Hangman extends Object

This object represents a game of Hangman.
It requires GameLoader.java to run.
Since:
2023-08-03

  • Field Details

    • PLACEHOLDER

      private static final String PLACEHOLDER
      The String used to represent a letter before it has been guessed.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • secretWord

      private String secretWord
      this is the word the user is trying to guess

    • guessedWord

      private StringBuilder guessedWord
      • the placeholder for the word that is being guessed. This will initially be populated with the '_' character for each character in secretWord. As the player guesses correct letters those letters will replace the placeholder character.
      • The String method String.charAt(int) method in the String class will be useful {Oracle Documentation }
      • The StringBuilder method StringBuilder.setCharAt(int, char) method will be very helpful.

    • remainingGuesses

      private int remainingGuesses
      Used to keep track of the remaining guesses. It is set to secretWord.length() - 1

    • score

      private int score
      Initialized to 0. Incremented when a correct letter is guessed

    • numberOfHints

      private int numberOfHints
      This is set to the floor of remainingGuesses divided by 2 when a word is chosen

    • guessedLetters

      private List<Character> guessedLetters
      The structure used to keep track of, and display, all the letters that have been guessed. This tracks the correct AND incorrect guesses. * Note that this is NOT the same as the StringBuilder guessedWord.

    • allWords

      private final List<String> allWords
      The words that may be selected for secretWord

    • guessedWords

      private final List<String> guessedWords
      The words that have been select for secretWord

    • debug

      private final boolean debug
      Used as a flag to display additional information

  • Constructor Details

    • Hangman

      public Hangman()
      No parameter constructor. Calls the parameterized constructor with a parameter of false

    • Hangman

      public Hangman(boolean debug)
      All this does is set the value of debug.
      Parameters:
      debug - if this is set to true then Strings will be displayed. See individual method documentation for details.

  • Method Details

    • chooseWord

      public String chooseWord()
      The chooseWord method is one of the main the methods that makes Hangman work. This method uses a Random object to select a word from the list of un-guessed words.
      Returns:
      The word that was chosen.

      A loop is used to ensure that the String selected from the List allWords does not exist in the list guessedWords.\

      If the selected word DOES exist in the list guessedWords, a new String is selected.

      Once an un-guessed String is selected it is added to the List guessedWords. The new String is assigned to the field secretWord.

      The field remainingGuesses is set to the length of secretWord -1

      the field numberOfHints is set to Math.floor(double) of secretWord.length() -1.

      The field guessedLetters is initialized to a new ArrayList

      guessedWord is initialized to a new StringBuilder of the same length as the field secretWord.

      The character "_" is appended to guessedWord (I'd suggest the String.repeat(int) method)

      If debug is true display the selected word.



    • readFile

      public boolean readFile(String fileToLoad)
      Creates a File object using the parameter fileToLoad. Creates a Scanner object.
      Parameters:
      fileToLoad - a String representing the filename of the file we wish to load.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the operation completes successfully. False otherwise. Uses a try/catch to initialize the Scanner to the file object. prints "issue creating/reading " + {fileToLoad} if there is an exception and returns false. While there are more tokens in the Scanner add each String from the File to the allWords field. if debug is true, print 'adding: + {word}' where 'word' is the String being added to allWords.

    • displayGameState

      public String displayGameState()
      Prints out the internal state of the game. Specifically it creates a String with guessedWord, remainingGuesses, numberOfHints, and guessedLetters and prints that. see the sample output for an example
      Returns:
      A String representation of the game state. Makes it testable.

    • exit

      public int exit()
      Used to exit Hangman. sets remainingGuesses to 0, printes "Thanks for playing" and returns.
      Returns:
      if the result of hasWon() is true return getScore() otherwise return 0

    • getHint

      public int getHint()
      If numberOfHints is less than or equal to 0, print "No more hints!" and return numberofHints.
      If there are hints remaining, iterate through all the characters in secretWord until a character is found that is NOT contained in guessedLetters call the makeGuess(char) method with the character. Decrement numberOfHints exit the loop.
      Returns:
      the number of hints remaining.

    • getCountWordsRemaining

      public int getCountWordsRemaining()
      Used to check the number of words left to guess.
      Returns:
      the difference of allWords.size() and guessedWords().size()

    • hasWon

      public boolean hasWon()
      This can be done in one line... :)
      Returns:
      true if there are no instances of PLACEHOLDER in guessedWord otherwise false

    • hasLost

      public boolean hasLost()
      won or lost?
      Returns:
      true if remainingGuesses == 0. Otherwise false

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      returns if the game is over (JavaDoc is PICKY).
      Returns:
      true if the results either hasWon() or hasLost() is true. Otherwise false

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      returns the score
      Returns:
      remainingGuesses + score

    • makeGuess

      public boolean makeGuess(char letter)
      This is the heavy lift for Hangman.
      first the parameter letter is converted to uppercase. Use Character.toUpperCase(char) If guessedLetters contains letter print the message: "letter has already been guessed" and return false if the letter has NOT been guessed print the message: "You chose: letter " add letter tp guessedLetters Declare a boolean to track if letter is found or not.
      Iterate through the values in secretWord checking for letter . If letter is found, increment score and set the corresponding location in guessedWord to letter . You will need to use StringBuilder.setCharAt(int, char) if letter was NOT found decrement remainingGuesses print letter was not present! return false.
      if letter WAS found print letter was present! return true.
      Parameters:
      letter - the character to guess.
      Returns:
      true if the character exists in secretWord and has not already been guessed

    • getSecretWord

      public String getSecretWord()
      standard getter
      Returns:
      secretWord

      public String getGuessedWordString()
